chapter_1_2_intro: ^Hero: Hey guys, how's the training going?
^Hero: How do you guys know what your combat affinities will be?

^AF: My dad was an archer in the Great War. Growing up my mom
always told me stories of his skills and bravery.

^AF: I've always wanted to be one ever since, it also just feels
natural to use a bow. What about you MF?

^MF: Oh, ugh, sorry about that. I was reading about this cool spell.
What was the question again?
^Hero: How do you know what your combat affinity will be?

^MF: I've always enjoyed reading and learning spells.
I think it's part of my nature. Why do you ask?

^Hero: The affinity test is tomorrow and I'm worried because there
isn't just one combat style that feels right to me.
^Hero: My grandma tells me that my dad was a warrior and my mom was a mage.

^Hero: She even said my grandpa was an amazing archer.I've tried the different styles
and I'm OK with each but I'm not sure which one is the right one for me.

^AF: Don't worry about it too much. The whole point of the affinity stone
is to let the person know which combat style they will excel at.

^MF: She's right. They say the stone is able to look into a person's soul
and discover their inner attributes.
^MF: As far as I know it hasn't been wrong about anyone.
^Hero: I'm sure you guys are right. Regardless of what I get, I'll embrace it.
^AF: Look over there, a giant rat!.
chapter_1_2_post_rats: ^Unknown voice: Not bad, but you still need more practice.
^Hero: Livar! What are you doing here?
^Livar: That's none of your business, but I saw you pathetically handle those rats.
chapter_1_2_no_rats: ^MF: That was a big ugly rat!
^Unknown Voice: So you think you're above the practice?
^Hero: Livar! What are you doing here?
^Livar: I don't answer to cowards who are scared of rats.
chapter_1_2_pre_rival:
^Hero: If you think you're so good, Livar, let's
have a duel to prove it!

^AF: I know we normally break these fights up you guys, but
perhaps a friendly spar could benefit us all.
^MF: Indeed, this experience who be beneficial to our training.
^Stormy: I'd be down for a friendly spar!
chapter_1_2_post_rival: ^Livar: You won't be so lucky next time!
^Hero: Quit being a bad sport cry baby!
^Livar: Let's go guys! I can't be around this chompsky any longer.
^Murray: He'll be fine. He just needs to cool off.
^Stormy: Well, we'll see you guys tomorrow!
^AF: You didn't have to call him a cry baby!
^Hero: Well he was being a bad sport!
^MF: He was, yes, but name-calling is not sportsman like either.
^Hero: I guess you guys are right. He's still a jerk though.
^AF: I don't understand why you guys hate each other so much.
^AF: It's been like this ever since you were kids.
^AF: I guess it can't be helped. I'm going to go rest up for tomorrow.
^AF: You guys should get some rest too.
^MF: I concur. I've had enough training today.
^Hero: You're right, I'll see you guys in the morning.
